questions.content:
If you follow these instructions, what is displayed at the end?
IMPORTANT: Make sure you enter the word exactly.

See the below screenshot of a Scratch project.
When the green flag is clicked, what will Sir Cat do?
questions.option_a: Move to the right silently until he touches the blue box.
questions.option_b: Move to the right until he touches the blue box, meowing as he passes through the red box.
questions.option_c: Move to the right until he touches the red box, then meow and stop.

questions.content: If you follow this flowchart, what is displayed at the end?

See the below screenshot of a Scratch project.
What does a correct password need to be like?
questions.option_a: It must have a '#' OR it must be at least 10 characters long
questions.option_b: It must have a '#' OR it must be exactly 10 characters long
questions.option_c: It must have a '#' AND it must be at least 10 characters long
questions.option_d: It must have a '#' AND it must be exactly 10 characters long

questions.content: Look back at the script in the previous question. When will the program stop?
questions.option_b: After 3 tries OR after a correct password is entered
questions.option_c: After a correct password is entered

questions.content: If you follow these instructions, what is displayed at the end?

Trisha is standing on the square shown below, facing towards the bottom of the screen.
If Trisha follows the flowchart below, what colour square will she be standing on at the end?
TIP: Use pen and paper to help you stay on track.

Test the project by clicking the green flag, then entering the word elephant.
What does Savannah Cat draw?

For this part, first open the Scratch project Symbols in the dirt below
NOTE : You may Look Inside and see the code at any time.
Remember, do not Remix the project.

If you enter the word rhythm nothing gets drawn. Why?
HINT: Try testing the program with different words, or examine the code to figure out how it works.
questions.option_d: There is a bug in the program.

questions.content:
To give the user a better experience, someone suggests adding some code in Savannah Cat's script as shown below.
Unfortunately, the new code has a bug. What is happening now?
HINT: Try adding the new code yourself to see what happens.
questions.option_a: Savannah Cat doesn't do anything now.
questions.option_b: Savannah Cat says sorry every time.
questions.option_d: Savannah Cat says sorry if they didn't draw anything.

questions.content:
One way to fix the bug is to change the new green logic piece.
Instead of it saying or, the green piece should say...

The answer to this question is a three-digit secret number.
To see the secret number, add the code below to the end of the script for the arrow.
To answer this question, you have to edit the code in the project Mystery Drawing III.
Remember, do not Remix the project.
Click below

Aussie Cat has encountered a cat who speaks another language. If Aussie Cat can work out how to speak to the other cat, she can learn the secret word to answer this question.
Try running the project to help figure out what to do.
RULES:
1. Only edit the code for Aussie Cat. You can see where to edit or add code by looking at the comments.
2. Do NOT touch the code for Scottish Cat or the Stage.
3. You will notice that there are Translate blocks available in this project. See if you can figure out how to use them.
To answer this question, you have to run and edit the code in the project Lost in translation.
Remember, do not Remix the project.
Click below

The answer to this question is the title of a book.
Marian enjoyed the book but she can't remember the title.
Luckily, she has a good memory for numbers and she remembers most of the book's ISBN, which means she can try to find the book using that number.
Marian has written some notes below to guide you in making the program she needs.
To answer this question, you have to edit the code in the project What book was that? This project is not available in the regular Scratch. Click below to download the project file to your laptop, then go to scratch.machinelearningforkids.co.uk and load the file.

To give the user a better experience, someone suggests adding some code in Savannah Cat's script as shown below.
Unfortunately, the new code has a bug. What is happening now?
HINT: Try adding the new code yourself to see what happens.
To answer this question, you have to edit the code in the project Worth their weight in sardines.
Remember, do not Remix the project.
Click below
questions.option_a: Betty reads out the weight (in grams) of every fish she caught today, removing each one from her list.
questions.option_b: Gary reads out the weight (in grams) of every fish he caught today, removing each one from his list.
questions.option_c: Betty reads out the weight (in grams) of every fish she caught today, without removing them from her list.
questions.option_d: Gary reads out the weight (in grams) of every fish he caught today, without removing them from his list.

questions.content:
Change Gary's script so that he calculates the total weight of all his fish and reads it out.
What is the total weight of all Gary's fish in kilograms?
HINT: There are 1000 grams in a kilogram.

Betty has a much bigger catch of fish today. Add code to her script to calculate the total weight of all her fish.
What is the total weight of all Betty's fish in kilograms?

Betty has just discovered that she must throw back all fish that weigh 80 grams or less.
If all those fish are thrown back, what is the total weight of Betty's remaining fish in kilograms.

When you look at the pencil's script in the project Mystery Drawing IV, you'll see two lists called x and y.
These two lists contain the x and y coordinates to draw a secret number.
To draw the secret number, edit the code to glide the pencil to each pair of coordinates in order. The first pair would be x: -130 and y: 150.
Enter below the secret number drawn by this list of coordinates.
HINT: If you're having trouble reading the numbers as they are drawn, know that the first number is complete after the 6th pair of coordinates. The middle number is complete after the 11th pair of coordinates.
To answer this question, you have to edit the code in the project Mystery Drawing IV.
Remember, do not Remix the project.
Click below

The answer to this question is a four-letter secret code.
In the project Mystery Grid, go to the Stage script. For now, the code just flips two of the tiles as a test.
The list called toggle sequence contains the series of row and column pairs for which tiles need to be flipped.
To reveal the secret code, edit the code to flip the tiles according to toggle sequence. eg. The first tile to flip is row 4 and column 4.
To answer this question, you have to edit the code in the project Mystery Grid.
Remember, do not Remix the project.
Click below

Alien credit card numbers are very short! Just 7 digits. But aliens are bad at typing, so they have to use Maths to check that they've entered the numbers correctly.
Which of these four card numbers is invalid?
There's a fairly simple way to check if a credit card number is valid or invalid. See the instructions below, then edit Smarty cat's script so they can say whether a card number is valid or invalid.
TIP: The variables for the coloured numbers are already created for you.
To answer this question, you have to edit the code in the project Alien credit cards.
Remember, do not Remix the project.
Click below
Which of these four card numbers is invalid?

The Alien credit cards project also contains a list called cards. How many of these card numbers are invalid?
Modify your code so that it goes through all the card numbers in the list, and adds up how many are invalid.
TIP: You can reveal the cards list by ticking it in the Variables section.

To answer this question, you need to spell a word with 9 letters. (No letter occurs twice.)
To spell the word, Supercat must visit the letter balls in order. A ball will change colour when Supercat touches it for at least 0.15 seconds.
Green means the letter is correct.
Red means the letter is not in the correct position, or is not in the word at all.
Red also happens if any other letter has already gone red.
TIPS:
Use the My Block reset balls to reset balls back to grey.
Use the variable confirmed word to store the letters you've determined are definitely in the word.
Use the My Block spell confirmed word to automatically visit all the letters that you have added to confirmed word.
You can create other variables you may need.
To answer this question, you have to edit the code in the project Spell the word.
Remember, do not Remix the project.
Click below

To answer this second question, you need the total distance travelled to spell the secret word, as a whole number.
Start from Supercat's starting position.
End at the final letter of the word.
TIPS:
You can edit the My Block spell confirmed word.
You can create variables you may need.
